Detailed Description

A cache for DataSection objects.

It stores the absolute path for each entry that is cached, and maps to a smart pointer. When the cache exceeds a certain amount, entries are removed from the cache on a LRU basis.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DataSectionCache::~DataSectionCache (  ) 

DataSectionCache destructor.

Just deletes the cache chain.

Member Function Documentation

void DataSectionCache::add ( const std::string &  name,
DataSectionPtr  dataSection 
)

Add an entry to the cache.

If the node is already there, it will be replaced.

Parameters:
name Full pathname of the DataSection
dataSection The DataSection to be added
Returns:
None

void DataSectionCache::clear (  ) 

This method clears the whole cache.

void DataSectionCache::dumpCacheState (  ) 

Dump the state of the cache, for debugging.

It dumps the state of the cache to stdout. Entries are sorted by access time.

Returns:
None bytes

DataSectionPtr DataSectionCache::find ( const std::string &  name  ) 

Search the cache for an entry.

It returns a smart pointer to the DataSection, or a NULL smart pointer if not found.

Parameters:
name Full pathname of the DataSection
Returns:
Smart pointer to the DataSection

void DataSectionCache::fini (  )  [static]

DataSectionCache * DataSectionCache::instance (  )  [static]

void DataSectionCache::remove ( const std::string &  name  ) 

Remove an entry from the cache (release our reference count to it).

Note that the actual DataSection will not be deleted until all references to it are removed.

Parameters:
name Full pathname of the DataSection
Returns:
None
